alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:54AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Warren, southern Henderson, northwestern McDonough, Hancock, southeastern Henry, southwestern Des Moines, southeastern Van Buren, Lee and central Clark Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 654 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Danville to 6 miles northeast of Luray. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Danville, Denmark and Lowell around 700 AM CDT. Middletown around 705 AM CDT. West Burlington and Iowa Army Ammunition Plant around 710 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Burlington, Gulf Port, St. Francisville, Wayland, Carman, Alexandria, Keokuk, Warsaw, Stronghurst, Terre Haute, Disco, Hamilton and La Harpe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren
